oai_dc:dc.dc:title: .32 caliber Smith & Wesson revolver
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This .32 caliber Smith and Wesson Model 2 revolver was used by local guerrilla Pud Diggs who operated in Henry County, Tennessee and Calloway County, Kentucky during the Civil War. He did not receive a pardon at wars end and continued to operate as an; outlaw. He was eventually caught in Kentucky. He was jailed and tried in Murray, Kentucky. Found guilty of the murder of Robert Miller, he was hanged and buried in Henry County, Tennessee near Paris. The holster shown with the pistol is post Civil War.
